title: Typhoon Yagi leaves four dead, dozens injured in Vietnam
content: The “super typhoon” shuttered airports and wreaked havoc on roads in Hanoi and surrounding areas in northern Vietnam.
summary: The “super typhoon” shuttered airports and wreaked havoc on roads in Hanoi and surrounding areas in northern Vietnam.

title: U.N. calls for full investigation into death of U.S. citizen
content: Two witnesses said Aysenur Eygi, 26, was shot in the head by Israeli forces. Eyewitnesses said evidence gathering was underway after Egyi’s death.
summary: Two witnesses said Aysenur Eygi, 26, was shot in the head by Israeli forces. Eyewitnesses said evidence gathering was underway after Egyi’s death.

title: CIA chief says Ukraine’s incursion into Russia unnerved Moscow elites
content: CIA Director William J. Burns made the remarks Saturday during a rare public appearance with his British counterpart, Richard Moore, in London.
summary: CIA Director William J. Burns made the remarks Saturday during a rare public appearance with his British counterpart, Richard Moore, in London.

title: Paris to name sports venue in honor of slain Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei
content: The Ugandan marathoner was set on fire in Kenya by her ex-partner, police allege. “Paris will not forget her,” its mayor said, according to the AFP.
summary: The Ugandan marathoner was set on fire in Kenya by her ex-partner, police allege. “Paris will not forget her,” its mayor said, according to the AFP.

title: Ukraine’s Kursk incursion already has its own museum exhibit in Kyiv
content: The museum director crossed into Russia days after Ukrainian troops and brought back a haul of items to portray a “picture of the war.”
summary: The museum director crossed into Russia days after Ukrainian troops and brought back a haul of items to portray a “picture of the war.”

title: Telegram chief Durov condemns his arrest but promises to ‘improve’
content: Durov argued that if CEOs are held responsible for misuse of a platform, no one would ever innovate.
summary: Durov argued that if CEOs are held responsible for misuse of a platform, no one would ever innovate.

title: Israeli forces leave trail of destruction in Jenin after days-long raid
content: Israel said it killed 14 militants during the operation, which was one of its longest in the occupied territory in years.
summary: Israel said it killed 14 militants during the operation, which was one of its longest in the occupied territory in years.

title: U.S. woman fatally shot at West Bank protest; witnesses say IDF shot her
content: The Israel Defense Forces said it was “looking into reports that a foreign national was killed as a result of shots fired in the area.”
summary: The Israel Defense Forces said it was “looking into reports that a foreign national was killed as a result of shots fired in the area.”

title: Beloved whale suspected of spying for Russia was shot to death, activists say
content: Hvaldimir the beluga won hearts in Norway’s coastal communities after showing up wearing a harness that read “Equipment St. Petersburg.”
summary: Hvaldimir the beluga won hearts in Norway’s coastal communities after showing up wearing a harness that read “Equipment St. Petersburg.”

title: Maduro likely lost Venezuela’s election but refuses to leave. What now?
content: More than a month after the authoritarian socialist appears to have lost in a landslide, his grip on power seems as sure as ever. It’s the opposition and its backers who are running out of options.
summary: More than a month after the authoritarian socialist appears to have lost in a landslide, his grip on power seems as sure as ever. It’s the opposition and its backers who are running out of options.

title: Ukraine’s Zelensky sharpens appeal to end restrictions on weapons
content: Zelensky’s appearance at the meeting of arms-donating nations in Germany underscores the critical juncture in Ukraine’s war with Russia.
summary: Zelensky’s appearance at the meeting of arms-donating nations in Germany underscores the critical juncture in Ukraine’s war with Russia.

title: How a Russian airstrike ripped through people’s lives in Ukraine’s Poltava
content: The central Ukrainian city had been relatively untouched by air strikes. Then came one of the biggest attacks of the war.
summary: The central Ukrainian city had been relatively untouched by air strikes. Then came one of the biggest attacks of the war.

title: Development Bank sues former president, alleging he abused office
content: CABEI filed a lawsuit against ex-president Dante Mossi, accusing him of breach of contract and abusing his office to benefit himself after leaving.
summary: CABEI filed a lawsuit against ex-president Dante Mossi, accusing him of breach of contract and abusing his office to benefit himself after leaving.

title: German police fatally shoot gunman near Israeli Consulate in Munich
content: The attacker fired several shots near the consulate and was killed by police. The incident occurred on the anniversary of the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre.
summary: The attacker fired several shots near the consulate and was killed by police. The incident occurred on the anniversary of the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre.

title: Rome floats plan to charge tourists at Trevi Fountain
content: Italy’s most famous fountain has an overtourism problem, but locals say restricting access might not be the best solution.
summary: Italy’s most famous fountain has an overtourism problem, but locals say restricting access might not be the best solution.

title: Typhoon Yagi, one of 2024’s most powerful storms, makes landfall in China
content: Packing winds up to 160 mph, Yagi became the planet’s second-strongest storm this year.
summary: Packing winds up to 160 mph, Yagi became the planet’s second-strongest storm this year.

title: 17 Kenyan schoolchildren burn to death in dormitory fire
content: Arson is often used by Kenyan students as a tool of protest over poor living conditions or harsh teachers.
summary: Arson is often used by Kenyan students as a tool of protest over poor living conditions or harsh teachers.

title: D.C. lobbyists battle over future of the Orthodox Church in Ukraine
content: Critics say Kyiv is attacking religious freedom in its efforts to break the Ukrainian Orthodox Church’s ties with Moscow. Ukraine says it’s acting in self-defense.
summary: Critics say Kyiv is attacking religious freedom in its efforts to break the Ukrainian Orthodox Church’s ties with Moscow. Ukraine says it’s acting in self-defense.

title: Germany’s firewall against the far right isn’t working
content: Recent elections in Germany show the limits of the nation’s statist efforts to stamp out far-right extremism and ultranationalism.
summary: Recent elections in Germany show the limits of the nation’s statist efforts to stamp out far-right extremism and ultranationalism.

title: Blinken visits Haiti in show of U.S. support for struggling government
content: Blinken’s trip to Haiti was a gamble for the Biden administration, calling attention to an unresolved crisis that, if mismanaged, could cause a migration surge.
summary: Blinken’s trip to Haiti was a gamble for the Biden administration, calling attention to an unresolved crisis that, if mismanaged, could cause a migration surge.

title: How other countries have responded to gun violence, attacks at schools
content: International responses to school shootings and gun violence vary widely, with some countries enacting strict laws.
summary: International responses to school shootings and gun violence vary widely, with some countries enacting strict laws.

title: Venezuela detains U.S. sailor, officials say
content: The incident occurred amid an increasingly adversarial relationship between Washington and Caracas.
summary: The incident occurred amid an increasingly adversarial relationship between Washington and Caracas.

title: Nicaragua frees 135 political prisoners after secret U.S. negotiations
content: Among those released are 13 members of a Texas-based evangelical organization. The prisoners were flown to Guatemala and can apply for U.S. residency.
summary: Among those released are 13 members of a Texas-based evangelical organization. The prisoners were flown to Guatemala and can apply for U.S. residency.

title: The Philadelphi Corridor, an Israel-Gaza cease-fire obstacle, explained
content: Israel’s demand to control the Philadelphi Corridor — a narrow strip of no man’s land — is a key issue in Gaza cease-fire talks.
summary: Israel’s demand to control the Philadelphi Corridor — a narrow strip of no man’s land — is a key issue in Gaza cease-fire talks.
